page.title: 0420th. CENTURY CHANGES
page.content: The villages have undergone several changes this century. Motorised transport made better roads necessary. Grass tracks & stone chipping roads were replaced by tarmac surfaced roads. Machinery has altered farming methods. Many hedges disappeared to enlarge fields & facilitate the use of machinery. This can be detrimental to wild life. Several small cottages have been demolished or combined to create larger residences. A blacksmith's shop was closed when its services were no longer needed & three village shops closed. The original Hams Hall was destroyed by fire in 1890. A replacement building was eventually removed to become Bledisloe Lodge, Gloucestershire. Lea Marston School closed, Nether Whitacre School has been threatened with closure.
